# Winter's Silent Witnesses
## Scripture
"For since the creation of the world God's invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that people are without excuse." - Romans 1:20

## Reflection
As we gaze up at the winter sky, we're met with a serene silence. The stars twinkle like diamonds against the dark canvas, and the moon casts an gentle glow. In this stillness, we're reminded of God's invisible qualities – his eternal power and divine nature. The creation itself testifies to his majesty, leaving us without excuse. Just as the silent witnesses of the winter sky declare God's glory, our lives can also reflect his divine nature. As we navigate the challenges of life, may we remember that our actions, words, and hearts can be a testament to God's power and love.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, as we marvel at the winter sky's silent beauty, we're reminded of your eternal power and divine nature. Help us to be silent witnesses to your glory, reflecting your love and character in all we do. May our lives be a testament to your majesty, and may others see your invisible qualities shining through us. In Jesus' name, we pray. Amen.
